data.enText: reduce sb/sth (from sth) to sth/to doing sth
to force sb/sth into a particular state or condition, usually a worse one
data.chText: 使陷入（更坏的）境地；使沦落；使陷入窘境

data.enText: a beautiful building reduced to rubble
data.chText: 已化为残垣断壁的漂亮建筑

data.enText: She was reduced to tears by their criticisms.
data.chText: 他们的批评使她流下了眼泪。

data.enText: They were reduced to begging in the streets.
data.chText: 他们沦落到沿街乞讨。

data.enText: reduce sth to sth
to change sth to a more general or more simple form
data.chText: 将…概括成（或简化为）

data.enText: We can reduce the problem to two main issues.
data.chText: 我们可以将这个问题概括成两个要点。

data.enText: reduced circumstances
the state of being poorer than you were before. People say living in reduced circumstances to avoid saying poor .
data.chText: （委婉说法，与poor同义）境况不济

tr: take off weight
lessen the strength or flavor of a solution or mixture
narrow or limit
cook until very little liquid is left
example: The cook reduced the sauce by boiling it for a long time

tr: be cooked until very little liquid is left
example: The sauce should reduce to one cup

tr: be the essential element
example: The proposal boils down to a compromise

tr: to remove oxygen from a compound, or cause to react with hydrogen or form a hydride, or to undergo an increase in the number of electrons
make smaller
reduce in size
reduce physically
example: Hot water will shrink the sweater

tr: make less complex
example: reduce a problem to a single question

tr: reduce in scope while retaining essential elements
cut down on
make a reduction in
example: The employer wants to cut back health benefits

tr: destress and thus weaken a sound when pronouncing it
reposition (a broken bone after surgery) back to its normal site
undergo meiosis
lower in grade or rank or force somebody into an undignified situation
example: She reduced her niece to a servant

tr: simplify the form of a mathematical equation of expression by substituting one term for another
lessen and make more modest
bring to humbler or weaker state or condition
example: He reduced the population to slavery

tr: put down by force or intimidation
example: The government quashes any attempt of an uprising
China keeps down her dissidents very efficiently
The rich landowners subjugated the peasants working the land

data.enText: to make sth less or smaller in size, quantity, price, etc.
data.chText: 减少，缩小（尺寸、数量、价格等）

data.enText: Reduce speed now (= on a sign) .
data.chText: 减速行驶。

data.enText: Costs have been reduced by 20% over the past year.
data.chText: 过去一年，各项费用已经减少了20%。

data.enText: Giving up smoking reduces the risk of heart disease.
data.chText: 戒烟会减少得心脏病的风险。

data.enText: The number of employees was reduced from 40 to 25.
data.chText: 雇员人数从40人减少到了25人。

data.enText: The skirt was reduced to £10 in the sale.
data.chText: 在大减价期间，这条裙子减价到10英镑。

data.enText: if you reduce a liquid or a liquid reduces , you boil it so that it becomes less in quantity
data.chText: （使）蒸发

data.enText: to lose weight by limiting the amount and type of food that you eat
data.chText: 减轻体重；节食

data.enText: a reducing plan
data.chText: 节食计划

data.enText: to add one or more electrons to a substance or to remove oxygen from a substance
data.chText: 使还原

data.enText: reduced circumstances
the state of being poorer than you were before. People say living in reduced circumstances to avoid saying poor .
data.chText: （委婉说法，与poor同义）境况不济

data.enText: reduce sb/sth (from sth) to sth/to doing sth
to force sb/sth into a particular state or condition, usually a worse one
data.chText: 使陷入（更坏的）境地；使沦落；使陷入窘境

data.enText: a beautiful building reduced to rubble
data.chText: 已化为残垣断壁的漂亮建筑

data.enText: She was reduced to tears by their criticisms.
data.chText: 他们的批评使她流下了眼泪。

data.enText: They were reduced to begging in the streets.
data.chText: 他们沦落到沿街乞讨。

data.enText: reduce sth to sth
to change sth to a more general or more simple form
data.chText: 将…概括成（或简化为）

data.enText: We can reduce the problem to two main issues.
data.chText: 我们可以将这个问题概括成两个要点。

simple_means.memory_skill: re- 再,又 + duc 引导 + -e

ex.enText: The local government has adopted effective measures to decrease unemployment.
ex.chText: 当地政府已经采取有效措施减少失业人数。

ex.enText: The company planned to diminish the cost of production.
ex.chText: 公司计划减少生产成本。

ex.enText: Water in the pond gradually diminished due to lack of rainfall.
ex.chText: 由于缺少降雨，池塘里的水逐渐减少。

ex.enText: His comments were only said to diminish the importance of her discoveries.
ex.chText: 他的评论就是为了贬低她的发现的重要性。

synonyms.bx: 指大小、数量不断减小，也可引申为贬低某事物的重要性或价值。

ex.enText: Her anxiety lessened while listening to the music.
ex.chText: 听音乐的时候，她的焦虑减轻了。

ex.enText: Exercise lessens the risk of heart disease.
ex.chText: 进行锻炼可降低患心脏病的风险。

ex.enText: The program has lessened the effects of car pollution.
ex.chText: 该计划降低了汽车污染的影响。

synonyms.bx: 指程度、规模等减少，也可指降低某事物的可能性、影响等。

ex.enText: We should take measures to reduce the price.
ex.chText: 我们应该采取各种措施来降低物价。

ex.enText: A plan to reduce crime was announced recently.
ex.chText: 最近宣布了一项降低犯罪率的计划。

synonyms.bx: 指降低价格、数量、规模等。

example.ex: It reduces the risks of heart disease...
example.tran: 这降低了患心脏病的风险。

example.ex: Consumption is being reduced by 25 per cent...
The reduced consumer demand is also affecting company profits.
example.tran: 消费需求的降低也影响到了公司的利润。

value.def: If you reduce something, you make it smaller in size or amount, or less in degree.

example.ex: They were reduced to extreme poverty...
example.tran: 他们陷入极端贫困的状态。

example.ex: They wanted the army reduced to a police force.
example.tran: 他们想把这支队伍降级为一支警察部队。

value.def: If someone is reduced to a weaker or inferior state, they become weaker or inferior as a result of something that happens to them.
value.tran: 使沦为，使陷入（不好的境地）

example.ex: He was reduced to begging for a living.

value.def: If you say that someone is reduced to doing something, you mean that they have to do it, although it is unpleasant or embarrassing.
value.tran: 迫使;使不得不（做）；使只得

example.ex: All the buildings in the town have been reduced to rubble...
example.tran: 城里所有的建筑都成了废墟。

example.ex: Politics has been reduced to class struggle.

value.def: If something is changed to a different or less complicated form, you can say that it is reduced to that form.

example.ex: Boil the liquid in a small saucepan to reduce it by half...
example.tran: 用小炖锅炖，收一半汤汁。

value.def: If you reduce liquid when you are cooking, or if it reduces, it is boiled in order to make it less in quantity and thicker.

example.ex: They are the descendants of emperors and kings and are now living in reduced circumstances.
example.tran: 他们是帝王的后代，但是现在境况大不如前了。

value.def: If you say that someone is living in reduced circumstances, you mean that they do not have as much money as they used to have.

example.ex: Her challenge reduced them to silence.
example.tran: 她的质问让他们哑口无言。

value.def: If someone or something reduces you to silence, they make you feel so upset or confused that you cannot speak.

example.ex: The attentions of the media reduced her to tears.
example.tran: 媒体的关注把她弄哭了。

value.def: If someone or something reduces you to tears, they make you feel so unhappy that you cry.
